metadata.title: CVE-2021-47485 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: IB/qib:Protect from buffer overflow in struct qib_user_sdma_pkt fields Overflowingeither addrlimit or bytes_togo can allow userspace to trigger a bufferoverflow of kernel memory. Check for overflows in all the places doing mathon user controlled buffers.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47485` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-169-generic - 4.15.0-169.177
linux-image-4.15.0-169-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-169.177
linux-image-4.15.0-169-lowlatency - 4.15.0-169.177
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-169-generic - 4.15.0-169.177
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-169-lowlatency - 4.15.0-169.177
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-92-generic - 5.4.0-92.103~18.04.2
linux-image-5.4.0-92-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-92.103~18.04.2
linux-image-5.4.0-92-lowlatency - 5.4.0-92.103~18.04.2

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-92-lowlatency - 5.4.0-92.103~18.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1107-kvm - 4.15.0-1107.109
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1121-aws - 4.15.0-1121.129
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1061-aws - 5.4.0-1061.64~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1131-azure - 4.15.0-1131.144
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1065-azure - 5.4.0-1065.68~18.04.1
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1010-ibm - 5.4.0-1010.11~18.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-169.177').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-92.103~18.04.2').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1107.109').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1121.129').
